intro: Tontelea tenuicula, commonly known as the slender tontelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Tontelea tenuicula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
